",orientation:"",linkToDemo:"https://youtu.be/TwjZg2efJU4",languages:"Matter.js, P5"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(CodingCard,{imgSrc:quizzania,projectName:"Quizzania",projectDescription:"'Quizzania' is an award winning web application developed using the Django framework of Python. Users had the opportunity to play others' quizzes and leave ratings as a way of broadening the scope of playability of the app. This app recieved 2nd place at the 2021 8th Congressional District Congressional App Challenge.",orientation:"left",linkToDemo:""+"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CcHUGIwACjg",languages:"Python, Django"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(CodingCard,{imgSrc:omni,projectName:"OmniFit",projectDescription:"OmniFit is an app that allows a user to find, log, and track their workouts all in one place. ",orientation:"",linkToDemo:""+"https://youtu.be/yV_9foj4YWI",languages:"Android Studios, Java, XML"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(CodingCard,{imgSrc:frogger,projectName:"Frogger",projectDescription:"This is my take on the traditional Frogger arcade game with a goal to guide three frogs into their “homes” at the top of the screen while jumping on top of logs and avoiding obstacles like cars, snakes, and crocodiles. As the player moves up levels, the game progressively gets more challenging.",orientation:"left",linkToDemo:""+"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GWPyif09xDE",languages:"Javascript"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx(CodingCard,{imgSrc:dealNoDeal,projectName:"Deal or No Deal",projectDescription:"Based on the original game show, my Deal Or No Deal allows the player to use intuition and analysis to open boxes that gradually reveal money values. If they choose to accept the deal they go home with the money they have and if not they continue to the next round.
